positive.review:
Absolutely amazing game.
If you grew up in the Windows XP era, you‚Äôre gonna love this ‚Äî the menu alone brought me straight back to my MSN days.

As for the gameplay, the pool is actually really well done. The background looks like a mix between a retirement home and a sketchy bar ‚Äî but hey, who said grandparents don‚Äôt throw wild parties with fifty identical bottles lying around?

The cues feel great to hold, the balls are big and perfectly round, and they make that beautiful clack sound when the cue hits them. Sometimes they even end up in holes.
If you‚Äôre into holes, this one‚Äôs for you.

You can even change the color of the table ‚Äî I recommend red if you‚Äôre going for a more... romantic vibe.
And the balls? Some are full, some are not, and they come in all kinds of colors. Truly a diverse experience.

Now, the soundtrack‚Ä¶ how do I say this nicely?
It‚Äôs like a McDonald‚Äôs burger without the bun, the meat, the sauce, the lettuce, the onions, or the pickles ‚Äî basically the soundtrack of the void. The music is about as present as people outside in 2020, if you catch my drift.

Anyway, highly recommend downloading it.
Also, the file size is probably as massive as GTA 6 ‚Äî a whole 50 MB.
Fantastic game has multiplayer and nearly every method/mechanic you can do in real-life. You can also practice alone with bots or just play with your friends using the multiplayer.
Cool replacement for pool and snooker enjoyers. Highly recommend it
Perfect! The best billiards game ever! No ruler, no aim bot, no aim assist, just pure 8 ball pool online with your friend! Awesome!!!

Deadass finally a free 8 ball game where you can play against actual people or the computer as well. Controls aren't perfect but it's a free game and it's better than the last 8 ball games that have been released in the past couple of years. I mean after leveling up you do have to pay for premium but I'm ngl the prices are affordable. Just pay for the one month for 5 bucks and you're good.
Great digital billiards with realistic ball physics. Every cue hit and aiming accuracy is felt

this game changed my wife: we played it every day for 12 hours together, we both quit our jobs, all we can do is think about Real Pool 3D - Poolians. I live on the streets of New York City now due to the immense debt im in from Real Pool 3D - Poolians: Premium Edition. I had to eat my uncle last week due to the lack of food, but it is all worth it for this game. Oh and my wife and me just broke up due to it because I beat her (not in the game, I suck at that.)

best pool sim i've ever played, does as much/ as little hand holding as you need it to, community is awesome
Fantastic game has multiplayer and nearly every method/mechanic you can do in real-life. You can also practice alone with bots or just play with your friends using the multiplayer.

Decent physics and 8-ball/Snooker modes make it fun at first, but the "free-to-play" label is misleading. Locks you out after ~500 games unless you pay for premium‚Äîtotal bummer. Also ran into obvious cheaters with weird ball glitches. Could be good, but the paywall and anti-cheat issues kill it.
best pool game i found. simple controls, simple UI, and very addicting even playing alone
Cool replacement for pool and snooker enjoyers. Highly recommend it

I came here to play pool, not to get hustled by a guy named "8BallDaddy69" who clears the table faster than I can say ‚Äúlag spike.‚Äù

Real Pool 3D is not just a game. It's a lifestyle. A digital dive bar where dreams are made, friendships are tested, and occasionally, someone rage-quits after scratching on the 8-ball for the fifth time in a row (yes, that was me).

[h3]Graphics:[/h3]
Shockingly decent for a game that feels like it was coded during a Red Bull-fueled weekend in 2009. The balls are round, the table is green, and I‚Äôve yet to fall through the floor. 10/10 realism.

[h3]Gameplay:[/h3]
Ever wanted to miss a simple shot while a guy in Romania hits a five-rail combo like he‚Äôs auditioning for Fast & Furious: Cue Drift? Now‚Äôs your chance. The physics are suspiciously good, which means you have no excuses for your bad shots, and I hate that.

[h3]Community:[/h3]
Equal parts friendly, terrifying, and probably full of retired pool sharks looking to relive their glory days between bingo nights. Someone called me a "cue clown" last night and I‚Äôm still emotionally recovering.

[h3]Pros:[/h3]
[list]
[*]It‚Äôs free
[*]Surprisingly competitive
[*]That satisfying click when the balls hit
[*]Lets you pretend you're good at geometry
[/list]

[h3]Cons:[/h3]
[list]
[*]Your ego will be shattered by a 12-year-old with anime profile pic
[*]No actual beer served
[*]I am no longer on speaking terms with my mouse
[/list]

[h3]Final Verdict:[/h3]
I installed it as a joke.
I now own three virtual cues, wear sunglasses indoors, and refer to myself as ‚ÄúThe Pocket Whisperer.‚Äù
Enjoyable and quite realistic pool sim. Good graphics and physics for the price. AI is decent, and it's a fun way to kill some time and practice aiming. Worth a try if you're into billiards!
nternational rules  are not appled  .....  would prefer a game that fallows the rules it would be more fun.  he fustration builds up and you give up .
Its a great game to play with people an it makes many memories with friends ... if you havent played this give it a shot.... think you can beat me ...think your good at pool .. lets find out ;)

Real Pool 3D (Poolians) is an excellent choice for both casual and competitive pool players. The game combines realistic physics, smooth controls, and immersive 3D visuals to make each shot satisfying. With multiple modes like 8-Ball, Snooker, and team games, plus daily tournaments and online matches against players worldwide, it offers endless hours of entertainment. Social features like avatars, chat, and friend lists make the experience even more engaging.

Real Pool 3D, better known to many as Poolians, has been nothing short of a gem in my gaming journey. It‚Äôs rare to find a game that blends realism, accessibility, and community so seamlessly, yet Poolians manages to deliver all of that and more. What might look on the surface like ‚Äújust another pool game‚Äù is, in reality, one of the most polished and rewarding virtual billiards experiences I‚Äôve ever played.

From the moment I launched it, I was struck by how immersive the physics are. Every shot, every spin, and every rebound feels authentic, as though I were holding a real cue stick in my hands. The ball movement is smooth and natural, and the attention to detail in how spin affects trajectory sets Poolians apart from countless other pool simulators. It really feels like the developers went above and beyond to capture the essence of real-life billiards and bring it into a digital space.

The graphics are simple yet elegant‚Äîclean enough to keep you focused on the game, but detailed enough to give you that satisfying sense of realism. The 3D perspective is excellent, letting you line up shots with precision while still feeling like you‚Äôre standing over a real pool table. The controls are intuitive, giving you just the right balance between ease-of-use for newcomers and depth for players who want to master angles, spins, and trick shots.

What truly makes Poolians stand out for me, though, is the impact it‚Äôs had on my life. At first, I treated it as a casual game, something to pick up and play during short breaks. But over time, it became so much more. Playing regularly sharpened my sense of geometry and angles in ways I didn‚Äôt expect. I started noticing how my patience improved, as I learned to carefully plan out my shots instead of rushing. It even carried over into real life‚Äîmy ability to focus, strategize, and stay calm under pressure has improved thanks to this game. It‚Äôs strange to say, but a digital pool game has genuinely helped me grow.

Another highlight is the multiplayer aspect. The community around Poolians is surprisingly warm and competitive in the best way possible. It‚Äôs not just about winning or losing, but about sharing a love for the game of pool. I‚Äôve met people from all over the world, exchanged tips, and even made friends who I regularly play with. That sense of connection‚Äîof sitting ‚Äúaround the table‚Äù with others despite the distance‚Äîhas been invaluable.

What started as a simple download turned into a hobby that I now truly look forward to. Poolians has become part of my routine, something I can rely on whether I want a few minutes of relaxation or an intense competitive match. It‚Äôs amazing how a game like this can brighten your day, bring people together, and help you feel a sense of accomplishment in even the smallest victories.

In short, Real Pool 3D (Poolians) is more than just a pool simulator‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience that combines realism, skill-building, and social connection in a way very few games manage. It has given me not only entertainment but also personal growth and new friendships, which is why I hold it in such high regard. If anyone is looking for a pool game that truly captures the magic of billiards while also enriching your life, this is the one to play.

Rating: 10/10

negative.review:
Not recommended. ‚ÄúFree‚Äù game that deliberately breaks after ~40 hours.

The game claims to be free, but after around 40 hours it suddenly becomes almost unplayable. You start getting nonstop errors like ‚ÄúGame login timeout1, please try again.‚Äù The client freezes, the servers block login, and the experience falls apart. It genuinely feels intentional, as if free users are being forced into buying VIP.

If this is done on purpose, it violates the very terms under which the game is offered as ‚Äúfree.‚Äù A game advertised as free shouldn‚Äôt quietly sabotage access to push players into paying.

They are not honest. If you want a stable, honest online pool game, look elsewhere.

Lol this is a great game while you're allowed to play it. Don't get me wrong, the game is great but once you're hooked on it like cocaine they want you to pay a subscription fee to play the game. You never own it, you're renting for a simple pool game. For a yearly subscription it is 55$. RIDICOULOUS

Total scam! You have to PAY to play this game when your free trial ends and it was not even mentioned when you launch the game the first time! This just sucks and is not worth wasting your time on this. Fine concept, ruined by the dev's greed.

this game calls itself a pool game but it does not even know the rules of pool can only really play 8ball outside tournaments practice has no option to no way to set base rules and it violates core game rules such as its always open after break this setys your balls it fouls you for doing legal combo shots and forces you to play slop which idc i play slop outside 8 ball anyways and it counted me having lost after sinking the 8 on a legal shot all mine where already in just cause i also hit a solid in after (i was stripes all mines where in already) that shot was perfectly legal i didnt scracth 8 ball went clean in first then a solid went in thats a win game marked it as a lost

worst pool game i played the dev needs to learn rules of pool

I started playing this back in 2020 on and off. With over 200 hours on record I can say that the "Trial Period" is new and never explained. 
It doesn't get mentioned until after you're in the menus and picking a table to play on. This new development will see the death of what was a mediocre billiards game. 
At this point it's not worth the time investment to download.
The game is a good Pool Simulator but it requires you to pay for a premium account after a bit
this game is a pretty good virtual pool game but isn't free like it presents itself, after awhile it will lock all playing features behind a paywall.
It's not free. 1-Year Premium Membership for fuxking $34.95.  And you do not buy the game, you need a membership to play the game. $34.95 allow you to play a year LOL
not bad cause it's free but bad because the physics seem unreal, i've played pool irl for years and somehow this is harder because of bad physics

A "torta" most commonly refers to a Mexican sandwich, though in other Spanish-speaking countries and European languages, it can mean a cake. The Mexican torta is a sandwich made with a soft roll like a telera or bolillo, filled with various ingredients such as refried beans, meats, cheeses, avocado, and salsa.

At first this was a nice little game to sit back and relax with. Robbing greedy freaks had to ruin everything by forcing payment after games. Selfish and greedy and really sad to see. absolutely pathetic. Ruined a perfectly good game. Utterly disgraceful

Not recommended. ‚ÄúFree‚Äù game that deliberately breaks after ~40 hours.

The game claims to be free, but after around 40 hours it suddenly becomes almost unplayable. You start getting nonstop errors like ‚ÄúGame login timeout1, please try again.‚Äù The client freezes, the servers block login, and the experience falls apart. It genuinely feels intentional, as if free users are being forced into buying VIP.

If this is done on purpose, it violates the very terms under which the game is offered as ‚Äúfree.‚Äù A game advertised as free shouldn‚Äôt quietly sabotage access to push players into paying.

They are not honest. If you want a stable, honest online pool game, look elsewhere.

The game has a trial period and after it expires you need to purchase a premium so you can play. The guys which made the game are just ridicioulas that they want money from you to just play the game and it`s nothing special.

Lol this is a great game while you're allowed to play it. Don't get me wrong, the game is great but once you're hooked on it like cocaine they want you to pay a subscription fee to play the game. You never own it, you're renting for a simple pool game. For a yearly subscription it is 55$. RIDICOULOUS

Total scam! You have to PAY to play this game when your free trial ends and it was not even mentioned when you launch the game the first time! This just sucks and is not worth wasting your time on this. Fine concept, ruined by the dev's greed.
